DataElement.preferredName: Target Radiation Therapy Internal Mammary Lymph Node Administered Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the administration of target radiation therapy to any of the lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Target Radiation Therapy Internal Mammary Lymph Node Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of target radiation therapy to any of the lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The goal intended to be attained.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any of the lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Any of the lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
